column1: MRI image size (128, 256, 1) illustrating the head of a man of 37 years old in weighting T2, with sagittal section. We observe slice n°104 starting from the right hemisphere of the skull. We see clearly: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 5415.8203 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 4854.1992 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 212.2559 mm³, the temporal horn of left lateral ventricle of volume 7.9102 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 494.3848 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 1550.3906 mm³, the left thalamus of volume 130.5176 mm³, the left putamen of volume 272.9004 mm³, the left globus pallidus of volume 141.0645 mm³, the left hippocampus of volume 201.7090 mm³, the left amygdala of volume 141.0645 mm³ and the left ventral diencephalon of volume 51.4160 mm³.
